title: Fantom class when restarting a test from scratch in IntelliJ gives "Couldn't find id field of null"
body:
### Describe the bug

At some point while refactoring our maintenance scheduling quickstart that uses quarkus, I get this "Couldn't find id field of null" error:


Ok, I just deleted some domain and Repository classes, so thats probably related. So I start looking at the code:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/176880/138453410-568438eb-076a-4bfa-a8fc-0ea71c2c2cf2.png)

but

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/176880/138453833-89ab0f37-eac6-45af-bcf7-edafe64a2a53.png)


### Expected behavior

Tell me which 

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

Maybe by running that MaintenanceSchedulingConstraintProviderTest test on optaplanner-quickstarts (github.com/kiegroup/optaplanner-quickstarts) and then deleting a domain class and getting that to compile somehow.

WORKAROUND

Run "mvn clean install -DskipTests". That succeeds and afterwards intelliJ's test runs file.

It looks like this could be Jandex index related and running a maven clean refreshes it.
But then I'd argue: can my unit test that I run in IntelliJ which has a @QuarkusTest annotation not refresh the jandex index, so I don't get disrupted in my development round-tripping?

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

Java 11

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.3.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
